Computing the Diameter in any dimension: Part II

Author: Matt Piekenbrock
Date: 2022-02-27

The Algorithm

We can now combine the above observations to give a simple algorithm. First, consider this high-level description of a sub-algorithm which finds a double-normal:

Double Normal Algorithm
  1. Set λ=0\lambda = 0λ=0 as the current estimate D(X)D(X)D(X)
  2. Pick a random point p∈Xp \in Xp∈X.
  3. Find the point q∈Xq \in Xq∈X furthest away from ppp.
    • a. If dX(p,q)>λd_X(p, q) > \lambdadX​(p,q)>λ, set p:=qp := qp:=q, λ:=dX(p,q)\lambda := d_X(p, q)λ:=dX​(p,q) and go to (2)
    • b. Otherwise dX(p,q)=λd_X(p, q) = \lambdadX​(p,q)=λ. Return (p,q)(p,q)(p,q).

This algorithm is guaranteed to terminate with some double-normal (p,q)(p,q)(p,q) and runs in O(nh)O(nh)O(nh) time, where hhh is the number of vertices on the convex hull C(X)\mathcal{C}(X)C(X) of XXX. By Observation #3, once th algorithm terminates, we've obtained a pair of points (p,q)(p,q)(p,q) on C(X)\mathcal{C}(X)C(X). Moreover, it's simplicity makes it very easy to optimize: only distance computations are needed, no fancy data structures with high-latency access times.

Now we can incorporate Observations #1 and #2 into a preliminary algorithm.

iterated_search(X, P)

m,  Q,  ΔX  ←random p∈P,  P,  0m, \; Q,\;\Delta_X\; \gets \text{random } p \in P,\;P,\; 0m,Q,ΔX​←random p∈P,P,0

while  (  Q≠∅  ):\text{while}\;(\;Q \neq \emptyset \;)\text{:}while(Q=∅):

     (p,q)←double_normal(X,m)(p, q) \gets \text{double\_normal}(X, m)(p,q)←double_normal(X,m)

     if(  dX(p,q)≥ΔX  ):\text{if}(\; d_X(p,q) \geq \Delta_X \;):if(dX​(p,q)≥ΔX​):

           ΔX,  Q  ←  dX(p,q),  X∖B[p,q]\; \Delta_X, \; Q \;\gets \; d_X(p,q), \; X \setminus B[p,q]ΔX​,Q←dX​(p,q),X∖B[p,q]

         if(  Q≠∅  ):\text{if}(\; Q \neq \emptyset \;):if(Q=∅):

             m←arg min⁡pi∈P(  dX(pi,p+q2)  )m \gets \argmin_{p_i \in P}(\; d_X(p_i, \frac{p+q}{2}) \; )m←argminpi​∈P​(dX​(pi​,2p+q​))

         else:\text{else:}else:

             break\text{break}break

return((p,q),Q)\text{return}((p, q), Q)return((p,q),Q)
